title: What number when multiplied by itself gives 1? - Quora

response.answer_text: What number when multiplied by itself gives 1? You mean what numbers! When we multiply a number by itself, we call it ‘squaring the number’. So, what you are asking for is what numbers, when squared, equal 1. These values are the ‘square roots of 1’. There are two square roots of 1 (indeed there are two square roots of every number except zero); they are: 1 and -1.

I wonder why people ask such questions. You should realise it costs quora a lot of money. But again, the internet is still a democratic place. To still satiate your curiosity, PFB Let number is x.Then, x*x = 1x^2 = 1 =>. x = 1, -1 The number is -1, 1 Hope it helps. Best of Luck :)
